titles.title: To amend the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to clarify that restrictions on baiting of migratory game birds do not prohibit the taking of a migratory game bird on or over manipulated re-growth of a harvested rice crop.

To amend the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to clarify that restrictions on baiting of migratory game birds do not prohibit the taking of a migratory game bird on or over manipulated re-growth of a harvested rice crop.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.

bill.summary: Amends the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to specify that the Act does not prohibit: (1) taking a migratory game bird on or over manipulated re-growth of a harvested rice crop; or (2) causing, inducing, or allowing a person to take or attempt to take a migratory game bird on or over manipulated re-growth of a harvested rice crop.
